Overhaul Chart3D to use timestamp-based view system \(TradingView-style\)

Major architecture change to fix constant glitching when data updates:

BEFORE \(percentage-based\):
- viewStart/viewEnd: 0-1 percentages of data array
- When data length changed, same percentage = different candles
- Complex identity detection using middle timestamp \(fragile\)
- Client-side aggregation destroying data fidelity
- Constant view resets on every data update

AFTER \(timestamp-based\):
- viewRange: { from: timestamp, to: timestamp }
- View position stays stable when candles are added/removed
- Only resets on actual token/timeframe switch
- No more aggregation - just binary search slice + optional sampling
- Identity detection using hour-rounded timestamp hash \(stable\)

Key changes:
- TimestampViewRange interface for from/to timestamps
- panByMs\(\) replaces panByCandles\(\) for time-based navigation
- Binary search for efficient visible data slicing
- SpeedBallControl now works with milliseconds not candle counts
- Data identity uses first/mid/last timestamps divided by hours
- Removed userHasNavigatedRef - no longer needed with stable timestamps

Benefits:
- No more glitching when data updates while viewing history
- No more data aggregation destroying OHLCV accuracy
- Simpler, more predictable view state management
- Better performance with binary search O\(log n\)

Bash(git -C "c:\\Users\\owenz\\Desktop\\pumplab" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix stale viewRange when switching timeframes \(1mâ†’5mâ†’1m\)

Root cause: React''s render cycle causes a race condition:
1. Timeframe changes, new data arrives \(e.g., 120 candles for 1m\)
2. visibleData memo runs BEFORE the view initialization effect
3. viewRange still has indices from previous timeframe \(e.g., 0-23 from 5m\)
4. visibleData uses stale indices â†’ only shows 24 of 120 candles!

The effect THEN runs and updates viewRange correctly, but by then the
first render already showed wrong data.

Fix: Detect stale viewRange in visibleData memo:
- isOutOfBounds: endIdx >= data length \(stale from larger dataset\)
- isStaleCount: visible count is way less than expected \(stale from
  different timeframe with fewer candles\)

When detected, ignore stale viewRange and show last N candles directly.
The effect will then sync viewRange state on next render.

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)
